intro: Machaerina philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine machaerina, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish-white in color. It is often found in lowland forests and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
